text: [Music]
AWS has helped us be agile in building
uh and running Production Services for
science my name is Ravi maturi uh I work
at University of Chicago and argon
National Laboratory at the computation
Institute at University of Chicago we
build services that uh do data
management for Big Data
and we build services for genomics
analysis and other scientific domains
our customers primarily are researchers
uh scientists at National Laboratories
at universities all around the world who
do big data science essentially science
as a service is this idea that we could
offer scientific data management
services and Analysis capabilities to
researchers the AWS helps uh a great
deal in separation of concerns we can
focus on the capability that we're
offering to our researchers and
scientists and not worry about the
infrastructure because we know that
Amazon web services will help run the
infrastructure with the
reliability we use AWS in multiple ways
for example Globus transfer is one such
service that runs completely on AWS and
uh we have over 12,000 users using
globous transfer to move data and we're
very happy that the uptime of the
service is 99.9%
Globus genomics is another analysis
service we built using AWS and Globus
transfer where researchers can go and do
large scale genomics analysis on AWS uh
by logging into globous genomics and and
running the analysis so using globous
genomics on AWS we were able to analyze
exome data and when we calculated the
cost uh to do the analysis depending on
the sample it cost us from $5 to $20 and
we were quite surprised at the low cost
of the analysis Globus genomics uh we
use ec2 uh for analysis we use EBS uh
and S3 to store the data sets that are
being analyzed on globous genomics and
we use glacier to Archive the data sets
once they are analyzed for globous
transfer uh we use uh AWS to host the
service uh we use EBS and S3 and RDS to
store the state of the of the transfers
for for users that are submitting
transfer requests to globous transfer
one of the big reasons why we selected
AWS is because of the API uh the API
allows us to build applications around
it and uh the API is very stable solid
and we can depend on it uh and so is the
infrastructure that uh the API
orchestrates and the whole ecosystem of
the tools that are developed around
Amazon apis like for example the chef uh
res recipes the cookbooks that we we use
to launch infrastructure and the fact
that we can do it once and we can reuse
it multiple times we don't have to
reinvent it helped us a great deal it is
in our best interest to achieve Hippa
compliance for globous genomics recently
Amazon web services started signing uh
baas the business associate agreements
that help us achieve compliance for the
analysis services that we build on top
of AWS AWS has helped us scale up the
analysis it helped us lower the cost of
uh doing the analysis and it has helped
us to build a reliable service the story
here is that AWS is good at what they do
we are good at what we do and together
we can actually uh be more productive uh
or we can use our grant money to last
longer
[Music]
